intro: Senecio maranguensis, commonly known as the Marangu mountain groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at higher altitudes. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow. Senecio maranguensis is often found in montane regions and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native environment.
